name: Hotel Chandela

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had spent the weekend at the Hotel Chandela, and were very pleased with our experience. Warm, friendly staff that always looked for ways to be extra helpful. The rooms are cosy and well maintained, if a little old-school. The buffet breakfast and dinner seem to cater a little more to the tastes of western guests, but they were quick to substitute spiced up versions of dishes for us. Elements of their food/beverage service could be improved a bit (hash browns that looked nothing like what they were supposed to, the unavailability of any coffee other than instant, and an underwhelming dessert section at their dinner buffets). I'd have also liked more local (read Bundelkhandi) food on the menu. Another minor irritant was that the carpets in the corridors smelled slightly musty (it's not noticeable unless you're sitting outside for a while), but I'm willing to concede that this may have been due to the just concluded monsoon season. We also used the spa for massages during our stay, and found the experience very pleasant (even if the offerings were a little basic). We didn't use the sports facilities or the pool, but they seemed well maintained and clean. The hotel is well located, just a short walk from the Western Group of temples, and in a quiet and clean part of town. Top marks to the staff for their pro-activeness and helpfulness. If they refurbished this place a bit, it would be taken to a whole different level.
reviews.title: Memorable hotel stay

reviews.text: This hotel didn't live up to the Taj's usual standards, it's very tired and the food isn't great and the bathrooms need some work.
reviews.title: Tired Taj

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side the service is great they couldn't do enough for me, I had a rush job of laundry and they did a wonderful job and very reasonably.
reviews.title: Wonderful Taj experience at unbelievable prices

reviews.text: The room was clean and a generous size, it's just that I have come to expect more from this hotel chain.
reviews.title: Not worthy of Taj brand

reviews.text: We traveled as a couple in sept 2012 and stayed here over a weekend. Great location, good food, CHEAP!! Nice, big rooms. Biggest Taj flavour :- we had asked for a dinner takeaway for our train trip back, they gave us a HUGE and AWSUM packet full of Paranthas and Dahi and a side dish and achars and sweets, and charged us almost nothing! will definitely recommend it all friends.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a relaxing stay

reviews.text: This is the only hotel to stay. The rooms are clean and basic. It is clearly a tour group hotel. It is like a Marriot or Hilton with slightly dated rooms. The staff was really nice and accommodating. The hotel does not seem to answer emails regarding booking excursions and trains. This needs to be corrected since it is unacceptable.
reviews.title: The only place to stay.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on a very decent breakfast and dinner inclusive package.
reviews.title: Some glitches, but overall pleasant...will go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked poolside rooms. One room was fine but the other was tucked away in the corner from where you couldn't really see the pool. Complained right away and got some excuses in response. Made my tone harsher and got a perfect pool facing room in no time. The rooms smelt a little musty but the monsoons were to blame. A bit of air freshener and open windows helped a lot. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom had a drape on the glass looking into the room that was electrically operated. The switch right next to the bathroom door made it roll up and down. Great for couples!
reviews.title: Good but not Taj Standards
Good hotel with very good service.
reviews.text: The pool was really good. Decent sized, clean and well maintained. The staff was also really helpful - busy arranging chairs and providing towels wherever we went!

The food at their restaurant was good too. On our second night we tried the traditional thalis (included in the package). However, there was a glitch in this meal. One of the vegetables they served was spoilt. But when we brought it to their notice they apologised profusely and replaced it with a freshly cooked vegetable in under 10 minutes. At the end of the meal the head chef came to our table to apologise personally. He even gave us his card saying we could call him whenever to ask him for any recipe and he will happily help. Really appreciated this gesture. Yes, one does not expect being served spoilt food at a Taj, but they way they made up, more than compensated for it. These things happen...it's ok...
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but nothing extraordinary

reviews.text: We stayed there for 2 night, Nice hotel brings back old hotel charm for 80's Bollywood movies....I love the simplicity yet all the modern luxury available in the hotel...Western group of temples are easily accessible by walk(1Km) or one can take cycle riksha standing outside the hotel...
reviews.title: Nice, simple and old styled hotel..Recommended

reviews.text: We have visited this hotel in July first week, though it was off season but the service we got was I feel better than any other five star hotel.the entire staff specially G.M. Mr.bhayal and front office I charge mr Jitendra Singh were there all the time,there staff was extremely courteous.mr Mukesh was always there to help us.
reviews.title: An excellent place for relaxing holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food quality was extremely good there chef mr mahesh payed all personnel attention to every guest,housekeeping in charge mr Arvind also left no stone unturned to provide best of there services.
reviews.title: Nice hotel ... just couldn't figure out how to turn off the lights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: though we were big group but each and every guest was taken care personally .
reviews.title: Older facility with wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing needs a change is locks of the rooms ,they should immediately change it to the electronic one.
reviews.title: Comfortable but Over Priced

reviews.text: We recently spent one night at this hotel whilst exploring gorgeous Khajuraho. From the moment we arrived until we left the next day everything was perfect. We had a room that opened on to the pool area which was very convenient. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had lunch and breakfast in the dining room and both were gorgeous. A very enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Good hotel, quietly situated on edge of town. A wee bit tired round the edges presentation wise (rooms) - giving the impression the hotel had once been absolutely the top of the tree, but is now being superseded. Loads of indoor public space, and all smart and clean. Excellent grounds and pool. Massage service recommended (good and good value). High quality food. Would certainly use again.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Lalit but had two meals here for the 3-day weekend we were in Khajuraho. Definitely the best restaurant in town--and reasonable prices tood. We had lunch with nice selectoin of Indian veg options. The next day, we also had pizza dinner here. Both times, the restaurant was very busy and nice mix of people. Service was fast and good for both meals. The lobby and restaurant seem a bit dated--- built a while ago. We didn't see the rooms, so cannot comment on that.
reviews.title: excellent restaurant at this Taj hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Standard old school Taj property and ideal as a base for a 2-3 day trip to Khajuraho, pricing is reasonable and make sure you take the newly renovated rooms overlooking the poolside. Taj standard is maintained as usual in all other aspects.
reviews.title: Best in Khajuraho

reviews.text: I stayed at the Chandela with my group at the end of September and though I found my room fine with a pleasant pool view and also the general hotel location and layout was fine I felt that the hotel was not being run as it should be.
reviews.title: Some problems

description: Hotel Chandela, a haven of tranquility, welcomes you to discover the historical temple town of Khajuraho. The exquisite 1000 year old temples at Khajuraho, graced with sensuous and sublime sculptures, are World Heritage Site. Hotel Chandela offers a choice of 90 elegantly furnished and well-appointed rooms including 5 luxurious suites. Wooden flooring, queen sized beds and writing table offer a touch of warmth to the interiors. All rooms enjoy refreshing garden or pool view.
